chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
X: Type
Red: reduction_t X

Goal:
forall (l : Lbl) (x y : X), Red l x y -> Weak l x y

Premises:
reduction_t = reduction Lbl : Type -> Type Arguments reduction_t _%type_scope
Weak = fun l : Lbl => match l with | T => star (Red T) | L a => comp (star (Red T)) (comp (Red (L a)) (star (Red T))) end : reduction_t X
Inductive Lbl : Type := T : Lbl | L : A -> Lbl
weak_tau : forall (y : X) (l : Lbl) (x z : X), Red l x y -> Weak T y z -> Weak l x z
tau_weak : forall (y : X) (l : Lbl) (x z : X), Red T x y -> Weak l y z -> Weak l x z
S_star : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (y x z : X), R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z
QArith_base.Qle_trans : forall x y z : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle x y -> QArith_base.Qle y z -> QArith_base.Qle x z
PeanoNat.Nat.compare_spec : forall x y : nat, CompareSpec (x = y) (x < y) (y < x) (PeanoNat.Nat.compare x y)
star_refl : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (x : X), star R x x
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y)...
EWeak = fun l : Lbl => match l with | T => union2 eq (Red T) | L a => Red (L a) end : reduction_t X
List.nth_error_app1 : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (n : nat), n < length l -> List.nth_error (l ++ l') n = List.nth_error l n
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
Tauto.GFormula_ind : forall P : Tauto.GFormula -> Prop, P Tauto.TT -> P Tauto.FF -> (forall t : ?TX, P (Tauto.X t)) -> (forall (t : ?TA) (a : ?AA), P (Tauto.A t a)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.Cj g g0)) -> (forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g -> forall g0 : Tauto.GFormula, P g0 -> P (Tauto.D g g0)) ->...-> forall g : Tauto.GFormula, P g where ?TA : [A : Type X : Type Red : reduction_t X |- Type] ?TX : [A : Type X : Type Red : reduction_t X |- Type] ?AA : [A : Type X : Type Red : reduction_t X |- Type] ?AF : [A : Type X : Type Red : reduction_t X |- Type]
weak_refl : forall x : X, Weak T x x
Field_theory.ropp_ext3 : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> forall x y : R, req x y -> req (ropp x) (ropp y)
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.le = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.le (_ _)%N_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinNat.N.lt = fun x y : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> Prop Arguments BinNat.N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
List.firstn_O : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), List.firstn 0 l = nil
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req...
Lbl_sind : forall P : Lbl -> SProp, P T -> (forall a : A, P (L a)) -> forall l : Lbl, P l
Lbl_rec : forall P : Lbl -> Set, P T -> (forall a : A, P (L a)) -> forall l : Lbl, P l
Lbl_ind : forall P : Lbl -> Prop, P T -> (forall a : A, P (L a)) -> forall l : Lbl, P l
Lbl_rect : forall P : Lbl -> Type, P T -> (forall a : A, P (L a)) -> forall l : Lbl, P l
Ring_polynom.jump_add' : forall (R : Type) (i j : BinNums.positive) (l : list R), BinList.jump (BinPos.Pos.add i j) l = BinList.jump j (BinList.jump i l)
Ring_theory.ARopp_add : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (radd x y)) (radd (ropp x) (ropp y))

```coq
intros l x y H.
destruct l as [ | a].
- rewrite <- (tau_weak y T x z) with (z := y).
  + apply star_refl.
  + assumption.
- apply weak_tau with (y := y) and (z := y).
  + assumption.
  + apply star_refl.
Qed.
